column4: Does anyone know how to configure jackd to start with the GNOME session?
System > Preferences > Multimedia Selector
Isn't that the gstreamer configuration tool?  Does it autostart services?
it is... but its how esd is started also...
gnome uses gstreamer... when gdm starts, its goes through gstreamer, which calls esd - which then starts, and plays the sound
change esd to jackd there, and voila  :)
Ah.  I was hoping to use polypaudio-jack for esd stuff, but first I need a session-bound jackd.
principle should still be the same... polypaudio calls jackd, which starts on the request?
Failed to construct test pipeline for 'Custom'.  Somehow that doesn't seem right.  Any further suggestions?
jackd isn't listed in Multimedia System Selector?
its not custom... you're using jackd, or should be
bah... polypaudio doesn't even have a -jack  :/

OK, I can do the chaining, but I'm not sure how to set jack-start-server early enough.  Also, no jackd doe not appear directly in Multimedia Systems Selector, although I do have gstreamer0.8-jack installed.
polypaudio and jackd provide the same functionality (sound server)
symlink jack-start-server to /etc/rc2.d with a low enough number...
I want jackd so I can try some of the softsynths that require it, but I'm just in it for fun, and so want polypaudio for the esd compatibility.  I thought there was a jackd plugin for polypaudio.
jack-start-server isn't a program, it's an environment variable.
no, doesn't appear to have a jackd plugin...
just esound for compatibility it seems....
I was convinced before, but looking again now, after yo mention it, I admit I can't find my reference...  Thanks anyway,
Yeah, that's what brought me here :)
